<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.
</misra_rule>

<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_CondVarGetInfo:
```c
int32 OS_CondVarGetInfo(osal_id_t var_id, OS_condvar_prop_t *condvar_prop)
{
    OS_common_record_t *record;
    int32               return_code;
    OS_object_token_t   token;

    /* Check parameters */
    OS_CHECK_POINTER(condvar_prop);

    memset(condvar_prop, 0, sizeof(OS_condvar_prop_t));

    return_code = OS_ObjectIdGetById(OS_LOCK_MODE_GLOBAL, OS_OBJECT_TYPE_OS_CONDVAR, var_id, &token);
    if (return_code == OS_SUCCESS)
    {
        record = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_global_condvar_table, token);

        strncpy(condvar_prop->name, record->name_entry, sizeof(condvar_prop->name) - 1);
        condvar_prop->creator = record->creator;

        return_code = OS_CondVarGetInfo_Impl(&token, condvar_prop);

        OS_ObjectIdRelease(&token);
    }

    return return_code;
}
```

explanation: Only the uses of standard string/memory functions need to be investigated for Rule 21.17. In this function the only calls to such functions are the two listed above. Other lines do not invoke any <string.h> functions and therefore are not relevant to Rule 21.17: the OS_CHECK_POINTER macro verifies the pointer (so the subsequent use of condvar_prop should not be a NULL dereference), the assignment to condvar_prop->creator is a simple scalar copy, and calls such as OS_ObjectIdGetById, OS_CondVarGetInfo_Impl, OS_ObjectIdRelease and the OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro do not themselves use the <string.h> functions in this fragment.
